articles.title: Argentina forms agency to manage cargo river, grain exporters worry
articles.description: By Hugh Bronstein and Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Aug 25 (Reuters) - Argentina said on Wednesday it had formed a new government agency to manage dredging operations needed to ensure navigation of the Parana River, which carries about 80% of the country's grains exports from the Pampas farm belt out to sea.For decades, cargo ships have paid tolls directly to the private

articles.title: Argentina, Brazil plan return of fans for World Cup qualifier
articles.description: Buenos Aires---Argentina and Brazil announced on Tuesday plans to use World Cup qualifiers next month as test events for the return of football fans to stadiums following Covid-19 enforced bans.
articles.content: A general view shows the Corinthians Arena in Sao Paulo, Brazil, on the eve of the 2014 FIFA World Cup Group D match between Uruguay and England. The Brazil-Argentina South American derby for the pre-World Cup qualifiers for Qatar 2022, scheduled for... [3005 chars]

articles.title: Amazon Boards Ricardo Darin's 'Argentina, 1985,' from Santiago Mitre
articles.description: Produced by Amazon Studios, La Unión de los Ríos, Kenya Films and Infinity Hill, ‘1985,’ about the Juntas Trial, has just begun shooting.
articles.content:
Amazon Studios, La Unión de los Ríos, Kenya Films and Infinity Hill have teamed to produce Argentina’s first Amazon Original film, Santiago Mitre’s “Argentina, 1985,” which looks set to become a banner Argentine big fest title and release in 2022.

articles.title: U.S. sanctions Paraguayan money laundering network
articles.description: Amid the Biden administration's crackdown on corruption worldwide, the Treasury sanctioned a money laundering network operating in the tri-boarder area of Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay.
articles.content:
Kassem Mohamad Hijazi was one of three people sanctioned by the United States on Tuesday due to participating in corruption in the tri-boarder area. Photo courtesy of SENAD Paraguay/ Twitter

articles.title: Capybaras Are Waging Class War in Argentina
articles.description: Groups of the rodents have been tearing up a fancy gated community in the wetlands of the Lujan River Delta near Buenos Aires
articles.content: You know how capybaras always seem to have a slightly skeptical look on their faces? Turns out what they’re skeptical of might be rich people’s bullshit. Now, in Argentina, they’re fighting back. Groups of the charismatic rodents have been causing a ... [2310 chars]

articles.title: Argentina says farmers have sold 27.9 million tonnes of 2020/21 soybeans
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug 24 (Reuters) - Argentine growers have sold 27.9 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 season, the Agriculture Ministry said on Tuesday in a report including data updated through Aug. 18.The pace of sales was behind that of the previous season, when 29.9 million tonnes of the oilseed had been sold by this time in the year, according to government
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Aug 24 (Reuters) - Argentine growers have sold 27.9 million tonnes of soybeans from the 2020/21 season, the Agriculture Ministry said on Tuesday in a report including data updated through Aug. 18.
